intro: Neraudia pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramidal fern, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, pyramid-shaped fronds. The plant features intricate, feather-like leaves that are typically bright green and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
